<<<<<<< HEAD
A vvord in season to the kingdom of England. Or, A precious cordiall for a distempered kingdom. Wherein are laid down things profitable, and usefull for all, and offensive to none that love the truth and peace. / By the meanest of the servants of Jesus Christ, M. Cary. Cary, Mary.
[4], 12 p.
Printed by R.W. for Giles Calvert, and are to be sold at the Black-spred Eagle at the west end of Pauls, London, : 1647.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "June 23". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Printed by R.W. for Giles Calvert, and are to be sold at the Black-spred Eagle at the west end of Pauls, London, : 1647.
